intro: Hedlundia neopinnatifida, commonly known as the New Zealand mountain holly, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along streambanks and in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and have a smooth texture. Hedlundia neopinnatifida produces small, white flowers in clusters, followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for native birds.
